original_title: Kentucky judge allegedly ran sexual favors scheme before sheriff killed him | Fox News
article_summary: Sheriff Mickey Stines is accused of fatally shooting Judge Kevin Mullins in Kentucky, following a cellphone exchange. Allegations suggest Judge Mullins demanded sexual favors from women in exchange for leniency, with an accuser claiming retribution if she spoke out. The sheriff, who is no longer in office, has pleaded not guilty to first-degree murder.</s>
